citation.article-title: Streptococcus merionis sp. nov., isolated from Mongolian jirds (Meriones unguiculatus).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptococcus merionis sp. nov.
Streptococcus merionis (me.ri.o′nis. N.L. gen. n. merionis of Meriones, the Mongolian jird, from which the bacterium was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive cocci that occur in long chains when cultured in liquid media, such as brain–heart infusion broth.
Grows well on both Columbia sheep blood agar and chocolate agar at 37 °C in a 5 % CO2-enriched atmosphere.
Growth at 45 °C is weak; growth does not occur at 10 °C.
Growth is inhibited by the addition of 6.5 % NaCl.
Weak growth occurs facultatively under anaerobic conditions.
On Columbia sheep blood agar, colonies are grey, non-haemolytic and 0.7–1.0 mm in diameter after 24 h incubation.
The type strain is non-motile, catalase-negative and oxidase-negative.
Spore formation does not occur.
Negative for pyrrolidonyl arylamidase activity.
Weak reaction occurs with Lancefield group D antiserum.

In API test kits, acid is produced from lactose, trehalose, inulin, raffinose, starch, maltose, pullulan and methyl β-d-glucopyranoside, but not from d-ribose, l-arabinose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, glycogen, d-xylose, inositol, d-rhamnose, melibiose or amygdalin.
Aesculin and hippurate are hydrolysed, but gelatin is not.
Activity is detected for leucine aminopeptidase, arginine dihydrolase, β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-mannosidase and alanine-phenylalanine-proline arylamidase.
Negative for α-galactosidase, alkaline phosphatase and urease.
Voges–Proskauer reaction is negative.
The peptidoglycan type is DSMZ type A11.29 [A3α, l-Lys–l-Thr–l-Ser(l-Ala)].
The type strain, WUE3771T (=DSM 19192T=CCUG 54871T), was isolated from the oropharynges of laboratory-kept Mongolian jirds (Meriones unguiculatus).
Reference strains are WUE3937 (=DSM 19912), WUE3938 (=DSM 19913) and WUE3939 (=DSM 19914).
